availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer. Maryland native. Married to Priscilla Becraft. Father of James H. Becraft, William Becraft, Mary Becraft, Mariah Becraft, Aquilla Becraft, Charles Becraft, and Walker Becraft. Farmer in Bourbon County in 1850. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1850. Farmer in Bourbon County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 292A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 504.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Eastern Division, p. 133B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Millersburg, p. 323A.
